issue.title: gamewith.jp

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://mobile.x.com/i/status/1858899697147986315](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmobile.x.com%2Fi%2Fstatus%2F1858899697147986315) ### Comment > This issue concerns the promotion of X’s mobile app appearing when opening a post in a browser. > > I’ve confirmed reproduction on iOS Safari and Windows Chrome (with the user agent set to iPhone). > Considering the possibility of geographical dependency, I tested with IP addresses from the US, Norway, Japan, Germany, and Israel, and confirmed it reproduces. > > > > In attempting to reproduce this issue using an iPhone, I took care with the following matters: > I cleared Safari’s cache. > I ensured no extensions other than AdGuard were enabled. > I powered off the iPhone and then restarted it. > In Safari settings, I disabled all content blockers and then re-enabled them. > After that, I restarted Safari. > I also restarted AdGuard, and checked for filter updates in AdGuard. During the filter update, I kept the AdGuard window open for two minutes. > ### Screenshots

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/213522#issuecomment-3322037200
>Recently setup AdGuard Home for network wide Ad Blocking; but it's not blocking ads on sites like YouTube like they AdGuard For Mac does.
>
>I've manually added all the same Block Lists that are in AdGuard for Mac, into AdGuard Home

Ads on YouTube are loaded from the same domain as other content, so unfortunately it cannot be blocked on DNS level.
Please use AdGuard extension or app.

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/213522#issuecomment-3326137341
>AdGuard for Safari is no longer blocking ads on YouTube.

Please try to update filters.

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@list-kr/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/issues).

comment.body: Hm, I see that the rule helps on your end, but I can't reproduce it. Have you done [the following](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/214162#issuecomment-3333745729)? Please also try to install [tinyShield](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/214162#issue-3453394666).
